content: may not sell or alter this pattern make as many for charity and gifts as you want bumble bee hot pad designed by andres p nevarez aka crafty andy pollen optional using a darning needle weave some of the yellow around lower pair of legs make a loose knot antennae make 2 with black chain 9 single_crochet in second chain from loop across finish off leaving a tail to sew unto head of bee sew them equidistant from one another at top of head wings make 2 with black edging of wings is done in single_crochet around the wing with yellow once ending with slip st attach wings in a diagonal way from the center upper body of the bee toward the edge row 1 chain 2 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook chain 1 turn remember this is the top row 2 row 10 single_crochet in each single_crochet increase 1 st at last single_crochet which is the end of the row ch1 turn 10 single_crochet row 11- row 15 single_crochet in each single_crochet ch1 turn row 16 -row 22 single_crochet in each single_crochet decrease at end of row ch1 turn finish off bottom flower optional with yellow or other color * chain 4 3dc on 4th chain from hook slip st to beg chain and repeat from * three more times four petals made fasten_off use some brown for the middle of the flower handle or hanging ring slip st black yarn around lower part of head and chain 20 sts slip st to other end of head ch1 and turn 22 single_crochet fasten_off weave in the ends stinger with the tail start close to the body row 1 chain 6 to 10 row 2 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet in next chain and in rest of chains weave in the ends you are done questions comments craftyandy@earthlink net ©crafty andy 2009 - copyright information you are not to make for mass manual or commercial production for profit using this pattern you may not sell or alter this pattern make as many for charity and gifts as you want
